definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: I can't help but wipe my ass with used toilet paper.
sentences.chinese: 沒辦法，只能拿別人用過的手紙擦了。

sentences.english: They once made a Ron Artest toilet paper, but it wouldn't take sh_t from anybody.
sentences.chinese: 有人試圖做阿泰牌手紙，結果誰也沒辦法用它擦屁股。

sentences.english: Some threw eggs and toilet paper.
sentences.chinese: 一些人亂扔雞蛋和手紙。

sentences.english: I could eliminate paper napkins and towels entirely.
sentences.chinese: 我可以完全淘汰餐巾紙和擦手紙。

sentences.english: Never use tissues or toilet paper to clean your eyeglasses.
sentences.chinese: 千萬別用衛生紙或者手紙擦眼鏡。

sentences.english: When go toilet, you would like to bring your own toilet paper.
sentences.chinese: 每當你上廁所時，你喜歡自己帶上手紙。

sentences.english: The word "origami" came to be used occasionally by the beginning of the 18th century.
sentences.chinese: “折手紙工”這個詞在18世紀初開始偶然起用。

sentences.english: Make sure that liquid soap, disposable tissue paper or hand dryer are available in restrooms.
sentences.chinese: 確保洗手間有皁液，一次性抹手紙或乾手機供使用。

sentences.english: Step onto a paper towel or any surface that will leave an imprint of your foot.
sentences.chinese: 跨上一個擦手紙或任何表面會留下印記你的腳。

sentences.english: If you blow your nose in the evening, the paper turns black.
sentences.chinese: 晚上試着擤鼻涕，整張手紙都是黑色的。

sentences.english: They come from very poor villages where they’ve never seen electricity or toilet paper.
sentences.chinese: 他們來自赤貧的農村，不知電和手紙爲何物。

sentences.english: Shoppers have cut back on toilet paper and cigarettes, once thought recession-proof.
sentences.chinese: 一向認爲是虧不着的手紙和香菸也賣不動了。

definition: to complete a course of study (old)/to graduate
cap badge (official sign of rank in Qing dynasty)
long-term considerations/to take the long view
